intro: Zephyranthes cearensis, commonly known as the Ceara rain lily, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It produces a bulbous stem that stores water, allowing it to survive periods of drought. Zephyranthes cearensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
